title: Self-Determination Theory-Based Citizen Science Cancer Education Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic scientific terminology and research methods, proficiency in using digital devices
context.additional_context: A program to enhance youth learners' (composed of medical/legal/technical professionals) capacity to participate in cancer research, combining online-offline activities with personal devices, with an emphasis on creative problem-solving and collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three roles as citizen scientists in the process of analyzing cancer research data.
Learners can apply two cancer prevention strategies to real-life contexts through storytelling-based case studies.
Learners can develop a research participation plan reflecting the three elements of Self-Determination Theory (autonomy, competence, relatedness).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
